com.mockrunner.struts
Class BasicActionTestCaseAdapter

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          com.mockrunner.base.BasicWebTestCase
              com.mockrunner.base.BasicHTMLOutputTestCase
                  com.mockrunner.struts.BasicActionTestCaseAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class BasicActionTestCaseAdapter
extends BasicHTMLOutputTestCase

Delegator for ActionTestModule. You can subclass this adapter or use ActionTestModule directly (so your test case can use another base class). This basic adapter can be used if you don't need any other modules. It does not extend BaseTestCase. If you want to use several modules in conjunction, consider subclassing ActionTestCaseAdapter. This class is generated from the ActionTestModule and should not be edited directly.

createActionMockObjectFactory

Returns:
the created ActionMockObjectFactory

createActionMockObjectFactory

protected ActionMockObjectFactory createActionMockObjectFactory(WebMockObjectFactory otherFactory)
Same as createActionMockObjectFactory(otherFactory, true).

createActionMockObjectFactory

protected ActionMockObjectFactory createActionMockObjectFactory(WebMockObjectFactory otherFactory,
                                                                boolean createNewSession)
Creates a ActionMockObjectFactory based on another WebMockObjectFactory. The created ActionMockObjectFactory will have its own request and response objects. If you set createNewSession to true it will also have its own session object. The two factories will share one ServletContext. Especially important for multithreading tests. If you set createNewSession to false, the two factories will share one session. This setting simulates multiple requests from the same client.

Parameters:
otherFactory - the other factory
createNewSession - create a new session for the new factory
Returns:
the created ActionMockObjectFactory
